New Records: Spencer Arrighetti's 47 strikeouts and 19 hits allowed in August put him alongside Kerry Wood as the only rookies in the Modern Era (since 1900) to record at least 47 strikeouts while allowing no more than 19 hits in a calendar month.
Key Match Events: Jose Altuve's steal of home plate was the catalyst of a huge Wednesday afternoon for the Astros, who crushed the Phillies, 10-0.
Yordan Alvarez belted three home runs, including a two-run homer in Houston’s five-run fourth inning and solo shots in the seventh and eighth innings for his third career three-homer game.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Joe Espada wanted to lead off his postgame comments talking about Jose Altuve's steal of home plate.
Yordan Alvarez said the team needed that spark early, that energy early in the game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Astros went 3-4 on a road trip against World Series contenders in Baltimore and Philadelphia to remain 3 1/2 games ahead of second-place Seattle in the American League West with 29 games remaining.
Yordan Alvarez has 28 homers this year and is slashing.352/.448/.656 with nine homers and 19 RBIs since the All-Star break.
Others: Mauricio Dubón temporarily saved the no-hit bid with a great catch at the wall to rob Brandon Marsh of a hit for the final out of the seventh.
Spencer Arrighetti had five strikeouts and two walks through two innings, and his strikeout of Hays to end the second started a stretch in which he sent down 11 batters in a row.
